extractions.description: This paper explores the generalization properties and limitations of Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) in learning identity effects, which is determining if an object comprises two identical components. It presents a theoretical analysis backed by numerical experiments to show that GNNs struggle with this task when using orthogonal encodings but can successfully classify symmetric dicyclic graphs.
